### tryToMoveFreeBeforeNullTest() {#a87ed771bf8f375c44d2c5451328d4637}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static Instruction &#42; tryToMoveFreeBeforeNullTest (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callinst">CallInst</a> &amp; FI, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout">DataLayout</a> &amp; DL)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Move the call to free before a NULL test.

<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> if this free is accessed after its argument has been test against NULL (property 0). If yes, it is legal to move this call in its predecessor block.

The move is performed only if the block containing the call to free will be removed, i.e.:
<ul>
<li>it has only one predecessor P, and P has two successors</li>
<li>it contains the call, noops, and an unconditional branch</li>
<li>its successor is the same as its predecessor&#39;s successor</li>
</ul>


The profitability is out-of concern here and this function should be called only if the caller knows this transformation would be profitable (e.g., for code size).

<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// InstructionCombining - Combine instructions to form fewer, simple</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This is a simple worklist driven algorithm.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This pass guarantees that the following canonicalizations are performed on</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    1 If a binary operator has a constant operand, it is moved to the RHS</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    2 Bitwise operators with constant operands are always grouped so that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//       shifts are performed first, then or&#39;s, then and&#39;s, then xor&#39;s.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    3 Compare instructions are converted from &lt;,&gt;,&lt;=,&gt;= to ==,!= if possible</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    4 All cmp instructions on boolean values are replaced with logical ops</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    5 add X, X is represented as (X&#42;2) =&gt; (X &lt;&lt; 1)</span></CodeLine>
